column4: re, I'm new to linux. What are the pro's and con's between kde and gnome. And should I install a seperate OS kubuntu along side my ubuntu or just include kde as extra gui?
You're asking for an opinionated opinion, so... get Gnome, also get KDE as a desktop.
Extra GUIs, there's mostly no reason to have a separate OS.
Then again, if you're new to Ubuntu, stick with KDE/Gnome for a start.
